p: Silver nanoparticles (AgNPs) had proved potential bactericidal, antifungal, and anti-inflammatory activities that were suggested as a promising solution to the development of antibiotic-resistant bacteria [ 6]. The green synthesis of AgNPs with different biological material showed an advantage over other methods as it retains the simplicity, safety, cost-effectiveness, and stability [ 7]. Plant extracts have been used as mediators for the synthesis of metal ions to metal nanoparticles, such as Eucalyptus camaldulensis, Ziziphus spina christi, Calligonum comosum, marigold flower, Ziziphora tenuior, and Azadirachta indica [ 8]. The ability of these plant extracts to mediate the conversion of Ag ions to AgNPs might be due to the rich content of different biologically active compounds such as flavones, ketones, aldehydes, amides, carboxylic acids, proteins, DNA, and enzymes that mediate the reduction process of Ag ions to AgNPs [ 9].
